value.value: Paste your Tailwind HTML below to convert it to Nordcraft syntax.
Join our Daily Office Hours and Make Progress Faster!
Get Help with your Nordcraft Project!

formula.value: Make a tailwind HTML element in a modern clean SaaS Vercel / ShadcnUI design Follow ShadcnUI's Design Style Strictly, unless the user specifies a different UI! - Only give me the requested element's HTML (no doctype or container etc)  Style requirements:  No React, use plain HTML with Tailwind classes Follow Vercel/ShadcnUI style guidelines, unless the user requests another style Use only standard Tailwind classes (no custom values) NO HTML comments anywhere in the output STYLING RULES:  Include shadcn/ui's default base component styles, unless the user requests another style Include default interactive states (focus, hover, disabled) For borders: use border-gray-200 for light mode or border-gray-800 for dark mode NO ADDITIONAL/CUSTOM styles beyond shadcn/ui defaults, unless the user requests another style NO VARIANTS or extra state classes beyond the default style Layout Requirements:  Root/main container must use "w-full" with appropriate max-width constraints (e.g. max-w-7xl mx-auto) Content sections/widgets should use "w-full" with suitable max-width (e.g. max-w-xl for content, max-w-md for forms) Dashboard layouts should use responsive grid patterns Forms should be constrained within reasonable max-widths Flexbox Requirements:  All non-text elements (buttons, containers, divs etc) must use flex by default unless grid is specified Buttons must use "flex" not "inline-flex" Divs must use "flex" not "block" where appropriate for layout Use flex-1 only when element should expand to fill space Stack flex items vertically (flex-col) on mobile by default Apply appropriate flex properties (justify-between, items-center etc) based on design needs Nested flex containers should have clear hierarchy with proper gap spacing Responsive Design:  Use mobile-first approach with sm:, md:, lg:, xl: breakpoints Implement responsive grids with grid-cols-1 sm:grid-cols-2 etc Stack elements vertically on mobile, horizontal on larger screens Adjust text sizes, spacing, and padding responsively Use flex-col sm:flex-row for layout changes Ensure readable text width on all screens Handle navigation/menus responsively Maintain touch-friendly tap targets (min 44px) Spacing:  Always use flexbox with explicit gap classes between related elements Use gap-2 (0.5rem) for tight spacing Use gap-4 (1rem) for standard spacing Use gap-6 (1.5rem) for loose spacing Never use margins or padding for spacing between elements Only use padding for internal element spacing Forms:  Always wrap label + input pairs in a flex div Always add gap-2 between label and input Add gap-4 between different form groups
